review.reviewBody: This suit is exactly like wearing an 800 fill Eider down bag. It has enough ventilation zippers to be comfortably worn in -60 deg F to 32 deg F weather, and all the zippers are easy to operate with one hand. The liner has built-in anchor points and is easy to remove and wear by itself. The "cube" insulating design forms to your body and works better than the Marmot gear I used 30 years ago that I thought couldn't be improved on. Pockets everywhere you might want one and all of them are exactly the right size. The colors of the various components are very pleasant, and there is nothing at all I would change about this suit.
review.name: Sate of the art cold comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was a little hesitant to buy at first with the price point but with the end of winter deal I decided to get one! I absolutely love it! The fabric it's made out of is very tough and resistant! I can sit on my snowmobile all day with no heaters and still be very toasty and drop the top half if i become to hot! The built in suspenders are truly awesome! Just an amazingly well built and thought out piece of gear
review.name: Excellent piece of gear!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent suit. Good range of sizes. I'm a female, 5,2" and had tried other suits and this fit the best.  Only reason I gave it four stars is that the inner liner is not attached and I lost it on my Manaslu climb and the company doesn't offer the liner by itself to replace it. Overall I would buy it again. Adequate pockets.
review.name: Warmest suit!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect fit and comfortable. Can't wait to my next expedition to K2 with my WarmCube 8000 suit
review.name: 100% recommend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and comfortable!!! A lot of useful pockets and zippers )
review.name: Even warmer then I needed)

review.reviewBody: looks like minion
review.name: Despicable

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago so I can dress up as a minion for gaper day at my hill. It absolutely unequivocally slaps. Super warm too
review.name: The absolute perfect base for my Minions co

review.reviewBody: This suit is of no use at 8000m where oxygen will typically be used, as the oxygen mask will drip condensate directly onto the zipper.  This will freeze immediately, rendering the zipper unusable, eliminating access to precious water and food inside the suit. The key feature, implemented on other expedition down suits, is to have a strong velcro-heavy baffle that protects the zipper, and in fact would typically be used instead of the zipper, so that the suit can be opened at those critical times when it's needed.
review.name: Missed the key feature

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Lightweight Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like the shirt. Cool I'm the summer Dries fast if given a chance. Example: after it rains.

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Lightweight Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Only four stars because only one chest pocket. Otherwise shirt is a home run. Size up one if you want it a bit loose-fitting for hot weather. I'm normally a L but based on reviews I ordered XL. Glad I did. Good fit. Not binding and stays tucked in but not too long to leave untucked either. L would probably be a trimmer fit, but especially with synthetics that don't flex or "give" like natural fibers, a little extra room is more comfortable and cooler at work. Wore this on a hot, humid day in 90s and it kept me as comfortable as possible. Seems durable/tough and dries super fast. Can easily had wash, hang to dry and it's good to go next morning. My only wish would be a second chest pocket for work stuff, but the single one is fairly ample with a strong button closure and has a pen slot too, another plus.
review.name: Great shirt.

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Lightweight Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this shirt because of previous Force shirts that I have owned and loved for many years. The fabric is nothing like the previous shirts, very uncomfortable in the hot weather. Returned them.
review.name: Not the Force shirts that previous Force shirts were!

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Lightweight Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shirt.  Runs a little large.  I'm 6'5" 280lbs and ordered a XXL tall.  Very comfortable and light weight.  Great work shirt and stretchy material. Wish it came in a few more colors.  But very happy with the quality and material.
review.name: Great Shirt

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Lightweight Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very nice shorts  my husband works in the element's and this shirt keeps him cool throughout the day. Will buy again

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Lightweight Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and very light and breathable. Great color for a sun shirt!
review.name: Must have for the sun

name: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Lightweight Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: These are the best tires for my Colnago.  I have rode 42,000 miles with my current bike and only tried competitors when I could not get these.  They outperform Continentals.  I ride on asphalt / blacktop roads, all seasons.  I have even rode these in rain, sleet and snow.  Very puncture resistant and once they break in, easy to change roadside.  First time putting them on, very difficult.  Otherwise my first choice.
review.name: I get 3000+ out of Armadillos

hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Todo 8L Sling - Cada Dia online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a quality bag, but you can only wear it in one direction as a cross-body bag.
review.name: Great bag, but not versatile in fit

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this bag for myself and have loved the comfort of the fit with the cushion of the strap without it being bulky as well as the clip so you can easily take it on and off without having to pull over your head making wearing with jackets in all weather easy. Handle strap at the top also gives the versatile use even better. Bag is a great size for most water bottles as well as snacks for short hikes or cross country skiing. Day to day use this bag makes life easier when multitasking and have your hands free. Front pocket easy access to quicker to reach items like a wallet/phone/dog potty bags you name it. This last purchase was for all the same reasons but to gift to a friend and I’ll definitely do that again because the quality is so good I won’t need a second one unless there is a color I can’t live without! This is one of 4 bags I have purchased in different sizes and shape and love each one for how easily they are to clean with all the adventures I’ve used them on!
review.name: This is the second bag of this style purchased and would totally buy it again

review.reviewBody: It is bigger than I thought it would be. It’s a good pack.
review.name: Good size sling

review.reviewBody: The bag was perfect for hiking with the easy clip strap so I didn’t even need to hoist it over my head to take it off. Very easy and practical. I also use it as my everyday bag, small enough to carry around easily, but big enough to hold everything I need it to.
review.name: Excellent bag for any occasion.

review.reviewBody: Love it! Sturdy, roomy, and comfortable to wear. Love the color, too!
review.name: Todo 8L Sling - Cada Dia

review.reviewBody: Great size, material and fit. Wish it had a few more zips/compartments on the inside.
review.name: Overall, great bag

review.reviewBody: I got this bag because I was looking for something that could hold my work tablet, was light enough that I could wear it for hours without my back hurting and would make it easy to take my tablet in and out. This bag hit all of those marks! I love it
review.name: Perfect Bag for Work

review.reviewBody: Ordered two slingbags, one in different colors and the other one in a solid color. Bags are nice and well made with pockets, recommend.
review.name: sling bag

review.reviewBody: Just received my Todo 8l sling and the fit is great. I bought it primarily for travel but may also use for short hikes. I am 5'5" so I wanted a sling that would not be too bulky. It holds my travel essentials securely without too much weight. .
review.name: Just right size for sling

review.reviewBody: I get to use this for multiple things as a photographer and city dweller. Also as a reptile pet owner my dragon fits in there comfortably and snuggles all cozy in there.
review.name: I get to use this

name: Todo 8L Sling - Cada Dia

review.itemreviewed: TX Hike Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They fit and were comfortable right out of the box.  Be sure to use the sizing chart for the correct size.  I am a Womans 8 which is 39.5 and they fit perfectly.  They are very lightweight, comfortable, and very flexible, like sneakers.  I need a more firm sole with less flex.
review.name: Great comfy boots but not for me

review.itemreviewed: TX Hike Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I don't normally wear hiking boots, and prefer trail runners even on multi-day backpacking trips. However, I needed some boots for a 4-day trip to a rainy, muddy, cool-weather destination. I like that these boots have a wider toe area and are lightweight but sturdy. They felt comfortable overall. However, they give me weird blisters on the bottom of my big toes after lots of miles (12+). I've never had shoes that give me blisters in that place! I wore them when I had to and was grateful for them, but switched to my trail runners when I could.
review.name: Some things are great, but blisters!

review.itemreviewed: TX Hike Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I don’t need to break it in, it’s very comfy and definitely will bring me to all the trails with no problem. I usually wear size 7, but I ordered 7.5 as La Sportiva is the only Italian outdoor company that seem to be smaller than my usual size. But I love everything about this boots. I’ve been eyeing it for awhile. Glad I got them now
review.name: Best hiking boots

review.itemreviewed: TX Hike Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these after my husband saw these. They are light like a running shoe, but have more support, especially in the ankle. I have done several hikes in these so far and love them!
review.name: Great lightweight shoe

name: TX Hike Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great showes and wide enough if you purchase the wide one
review.name: Happy Customer
comment: Thank you! We love hearing from happy customers!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really comfortable. During break-in, the collar pressed uncomfortably on one side. It's gotten better but still can't wear them as daily shoes. That's not meant as a complaint but just a note to designers. Maybe it'll help, maybe not.
review.name: Mostly great

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love them except for one thing. They smell bad. Otherwise, they fit well and are really comfortable. This is the first waterproof pair I have purchased and I don't know if that is what smells. Back to a regular pair.
review.name: Won't buy waterproof again

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This my second pair of these hikers. They are an excellent fit and comfortable. I purchased many other brands in the past and Merrell are by far the best I’ve ever had. Highly recommended.
review.name: Best hiker on the market
comment: Thank you for the excellent feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fantastic Shoes. Bought a pair from a retailer back in January. Only problem I had was my fault because I should have looked for a 12.5 instead of buying a 12. I still wore them off and on for a few months. Then I decided I wanted another pair that was a 12.5 so figure I would go directly through the company. They are of great quality, comfortable and have some grips.
review.name: Fantastic
comment: We value your feedback tremendously.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wore this pair for the first time at Universal Orlando. They felt great. Didn’t keep my feet dry on the bulge barge , but still great shoes.
review.name: Love my Merrells

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable, great treads, roomy toe-box and pretty good-looking. I would have given them 5 stars, but the waterproofing had to be refreshed very soon.
review.name: Great shoe, but you have to redo the waterproofing

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I always have problems finding shoes that fit and comfortable. I wear a size 12 but don’t consider myself to have big feet but finding shoes that my feet especially just before the toe area doesn’t constrict my feet is not easy to do, especially in hikers . Not only do this shoes fit my feet perfectly they are extremely comfortable to walk and stand in for hours . The bonus of them being waterproof also makes it nice during a rain or walking through some light snow that my socks are not getting wet .
review.name: Finally a hiker that fits !

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Second pair. There will likely be a third. Comfy and very rugged and long lasting.
review.name: Bought them again

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Horrible fit, Too heavy. Threw it out in 2 weeks while on a trek. Beware, do not buy online  They  refused to exchange or take it back if worn even once.
review.name: Do not buy online.

name: Moab 3 Waterproof Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Crater Lake Crop Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: This sun shirt is super cute. The fit and pattern are stylish for outdoor gear. I’m 5’2” 115lb 34A and size S worked well for me. Only issue is that it’s not as perfect for climbing as I would have liked. My harness sits below it since it’s cropped. Not the most comfortable and lower visibility of my harness and the gear on it. But I’ll still use it climbing anyway, gotta look cute.
review.name: Functional and Stylish

review.itemreviewed: Crater Lake Crop Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Perfect shirt to wear on a sunny hike and it did the job!
review.name: Perfects

review.itemreviewed: Crater Lake Crop Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love ❤️ this ! I used it paddle boarding and it’s good coverage under the hot sun. The length is for me 4’11 🤗
review.name: Love this!

review.itemreviewed: Crater Lake Crop Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Perfect length and silky soft! Light and breathable! By far my favorite hiking shirt! Took a huge fall and no rips in it and blood came out easily
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Crater Lake Crop Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and versatile. Purchased to wear paddleboarding, but also great for trail and casual wear. Even better than anticipated.
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Crater Lake Crop Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have a history of skin cancer, and bought this shirt to wear outdoors as a sunscreen alternative. I love the fabric and fit. My dermatologist said upf clothing was a great investment. I’m glad I found this item! Love it!
review.name: Great investment for skin health

review.itemreviewed: Crater Lake Crop Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this top! Its really comfortable and has a really soft texture. I got a medium and im 4'10 at 150lbs and it fits me well. Wished it was cinched at the waist a little bit more but i still love it! I also like how the color/pattern is pretty practical so I can go backpacking in it without worrying about how dirty itll look
review.name: Very cute and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Crater Lake Crop Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: My favorite sun shirt. The print is so fun! Fabric is lightweight and soft.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the mummy silk liner. . love how small it packs down which is great for hut to hut hikes.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect. Made hut sleeping luxurious. Addicted to silk! Treating myself to something new from S2S with each new hiking trip! New to ultralight and I’m a convert. Makes a significant difference negotiating steep inclines.
review.name: Perfect. Made hut sleeping luxurious.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super soft material after a wash, used with the Ember Quilt mostly as a way to keep the quilt clean. Also used in hostel rooms alone and was plenty warm if you’re a warm sleeper like me.
review.name: Solid Kit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good. Tried a few days before going out. Seemed ok. Worked well during recent outing in Onion Valley, CA area. Nice to have something over the layer of trail dust. A bit hot one might just open up foot area for cooling option.
review.name: First bag liner

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This light weight line would be great on its own for those hot camping nights or for the extra boost of heat on the chilly nights. It’s lightweight, packs nice and small in the convenient bag
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable liner. I love the material -- it doesn't stick to my baselayers and the stretchy side panels allow for plenty of mobility inside the liner.
review.name: Lightweight Comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Silk Blend Liner was a great addition to my warm and comfort inside my sleeping bag when I went camping.  It's made with Thermolite Ecomode for a boost of warmth.  This is a mummy shaped bag with a fitted hood, so it even keeps your ears warm.  It's made with Heiq Fresh odor technology, to neutralize smelly air so my silk bag stayed super fresh.  I'm short and had plenty of room to move.  For the taller folks, it has a max height of 78".  After use, I just fold it up and stuff it into the included drawstring bag for easy storage.  This is really is the hot ticket for staying warm!
review.name: Keeps you warm and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve never had a separate sleeping bag liner before, so this was exciting for me to try out! It has a very light feel to it- nothing heavy or too thick. It’s kind of like adding a light blanket to your bed - just a hint of extra warm ness.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and soft silk liner. Seems durable for camping. Insulated well and versatile. I would highly recommend for those that have this sleeping bag.
review.name: Soft and comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I havent been able to use this yet as it's been hot or raining here but I did test it out inside and it's pretty nice. Feels good around everything..
review.name: Could go with or without

name: Silk Blend Sleeping Bag Liner

hasVariant.name: Compact Road Handlebar
hasVariant.description: Buy the ENVE Compact Road Handlebar online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Compact Road Handlebar
hasVariant.description: Buy the ENVE Compact Road Handlebar online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a carbon bar with measurements similar to what I had (80mm drop, 125mm reach) that would accommodate Di2 bar end plug integration, and (as much as aero bars are cool) was not aero so that I would save myself headaches trying to fit accessories to it (e.g. Garmin mount).

This was basically the only bar that met all that criteria.

But now what size to get... The specs on ENVE's site are good, and they detail the 2cm FLARE at the drops, however, neither ENVE nor Competitive Cyclist say how they're measuring the bars when you're choosing a size: 42cm... Is that at the drops or at the hoods? Because at the hoods, it'll be 40cm if it flares to 42 at the drops. Or is it the opposite? 42 at the hoods, so 44 at the drops?

Let me clarify: It's measured at the hoods. So if you buy size 40cm (center to center), it'll flare to 42cm at the drops.

Maybe that's obvious to some, but for me -- who (somehow) didn't realize that his current bars also had a flare -- it was a big question mark. I thought mine were 42cm straight down.

So I got the 42cm bars. And I compared, and measured twice, of course, and then I mounted them... and then discovered they were much wider than I was used to.

Lesson learned: Never assume, even from your notes(!!), and measure at the drops and the hoods on your current bars.

I couldn't return them (because they had been mounted) and had to buy a pair of 40s off ENVE because CC had run out of that size. These are hard to find on the Internet right now, stock is very limited.
review.name: Awesome bars but CAREFUL THE FLARE
comment: How do these work with the di2 bar-end plug? They look like they have tapered ends that won't fit the junction box.

name: Compact Road Handlebar

review.reviewBody: Excellent boots. Waterproof and warm. Perfect for what I bought them for. Thanks for a great product. Very comfortable.
review.name: Excellent boots.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair in 12 years. I'm usually working in 15 to 20f on ice under 18 inches of snow. These work very well. The new ones have more insulation and should be even better.
review.name: Bought a second pair, they work.

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite winter hiking boots I’ve ever owned. Comfortable as can be, and super warm. They fit well with snowshoes when it’s really deep and pants can clip to the laces. No snow gets in. Good grip on everything but hard ice. The only issue I had was when I didn’t wear socks and they dug in a bit above the ankle. 2 seasons of use and they still look great!
review.name: My go-to winter activity boot!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee ll Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: After one year the soles are coming apart. They were great shoes but new material doesn’t hold up, very disappointing as I only wore them occasionally in normal suburban settings.

review.itemreviewed: Targhee ll Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the greatest hiking shoes I have ever owned even though the last 5 pair have been Keen brand this new model is hands down the best
review.name: Super shoes

review.itemreviewed: Targhee ll Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: shoes fit well and are comfortable to walk in over longer distances
review.name: shoes fit well and are

review.itemreviewed: Targhee ll Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes fit me perfectly and they are extremely comfortable as I have been accustomed to from my prior Keen purchases.
review.name: These shoes fit me perfectly

review.itemreviewed: Targhee ll Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These have been the only shoes on my feet the last decade. . . . no kidding. Well thats a lie, I have them in mid tops, too and a pair of Keen Austin Oxfords too. They are perfect. Great fit right out of the box and need no breaking in! Last about a year for me as I am not easy on them. Great look and feel!
review.name: fantastic shoe

review.itemreviewed: Targhee ll Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have bought these shoes before but this pair seem a bit larger than previous pairs.
review.name: A little loose

review.itemreviewed: Targhee ll Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Today I am 62 working on my feet on concrete all day . My shoes and feet were in pain causing me to limp. 
I was a little skeptical of the keen brand but a coworker said he wears them every day. 
I could not find my size in the retail store. This search went to the internet . Now we are happy feet no limping. Work in them all day all week. . 
Just a note 5 boots later. with keen footwear knows what my feet need. So thankful for a peaceful day on the Job. 

 Thanks again Madison
review.name: No pain, no limping

review.itemreviewed: Targhee ll Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These shoes are not right. The size seems to be correct, however with each step that I take my foot slides forward into the front of the shoe impacting my toes. Even if I tighten them up, they still want to push forward. 

These are not made correctly.
review.name: Not made correctly

review.itemreviewed: Targhee ll Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Waterproof, renn faire proof , comphy ,tough, perfect .
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: Good shoe....construction overall better than Merrill....runs slightly large...very good price when bought on sale.

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Way too small and narrow, and squeaks terribly. I normally wear a size 13 in Nike and Under Armour, got a 13 in this shoe and could barely squeeze my foot into it. I had measured how the sizing guide told me too and thought the 13 would be plenty big, but it wasn’t even close.
review.name: Sizing guide is misleading

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Pretty great hiking shoe and not getting the squeaking everybody else was saying their reviews.  It’s waterproof as far as I have tested so far and I definitely purposely stepped in a few puddles that came over the top of the shoe.  It’s solid!
review.name: Pretty great hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I really like the look of this shoe, aesthetically but ended up returning.  I thought the silhouette was current and interesting but the toe box material was not ideal. It did have a plastic-type sound when wearing, I’m not sure if it was the waterproofing material but I could hear it every step I took.

I thought the shoe was moderately comfortable, I like the color way. 

If the material noise isn’t an issue for someone, then I would recommend this shoe for them. Very budget-friendly.
review.name: Be Mindful

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well made shoe that does the job. Keeps feet dry. The noise that some complain of stops after a day or two.
review.name: Well made. Solid.

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I liked the look of those shoes and when they arrived they fit great, felt really good when I wore them around the house.  Seem like they will become my go to shoe going forward.
review.name: Good shoes

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
very comfortable , light, nice.
the price is very good too.
it fits perfect.
review.name: very comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm not satisfied this model, it was posted like waterproof, but after one month they started be not waterproof, and after rain I feel wet socks... And one more thing, when you walk you can hear noise like plastic bag...
review.name: Not satisfied

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shoes fit pretty well and are surprisingly comfortable. They do make a slight sound when walking but I think it's the waterproof membrane. Retro-ish styling.
review.name: Good and comfortable shoes.

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased  these shoes to go hiking but I never even made it to the trails.  I wore them once to start breaking them in but the shoes makes a lot of noise when stepping.  I would describe it as- a grocery plastic bag making noise.  Others have said the same about the noise.
review.name: Columbia Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe
comment:
Hey there!

I'm so sorry to hear about the issues with your shoes. If you haven't already, please feel free to reach out to a Gearhead--we'd be happy to set you up with a free return or exchange on these!

review.itemreviewed: Pivot Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Shoe are comfortable and fit well. Traction on wet concrete surfaces is horrible. I would not recommend these shoes to anyone unless you like to ice skate on a regular basis.
review.name: Little Traction on wet surfaces

hasVariant.name: Lined Chore Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Lined Chore Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My wife loves this jacket so much she asked me to buy her a second one.
review.name: Had to buy a second one

review.reviewBody: I bought this expecting not to use it until next year but it has literally become my go to everyday layer for yard work to campfire sitting and dog walking. It's cut generously and is comfy and stylish.
review.name: I love this jacket!

author.name: If you're thinking about it- buy it.

review.reviewBody: Not very roomy. Sleeves are long enough, but it is tight through the shoulders. This is much more lightweight than I expected. I cannot layer beneath it because it fits tight through the shoulders. This jacket was described as a "chore jacket" but it does not allow me to move at the shoulders to perform "chore activities".
review.name: Not What I Expected

review.reviewBody: Great jacket and nice warm feeling
review.name: Awesome warmth

review.reviewBody: Having bought several OR jackets before and having experience that a size medium works really well for me, I was surprised that this jacket to fit so awkwardly. It has short hem and sleeves and is wide in the body - as if OR designers think that humans are shaped like a square.
review.name: Fits like a box

review.reviewBody: Great fitting and looking Jacket! Comfortable and warm! Plan on keeping this a long time!
review.name: Great Fit!

review.reviewBody: The arms on this jacket are at least 3" longer than the other jacket purchased.
review.name: Short arms only in this jacket

review.reviewBody: Great quality and durability. Love the fit too. Just wish it had side hand pockets.
review.name: Quality and durability

review.reviewBody: Great jacket! I would have given this wonderful jacket five stars if it had a zipper instead of buttons. Having said that, being very hard on my jackets, I like the idea that (hopefully) these buttons will last longer than my zippers have. I'm 5 foot 4 and weigh less than 120 lbs. I would consider myself having an athletic build. My jacket was a Small. It fit perfectly with enough room to move and layer a sweatshirt, long sleeve t-shirt and tank top underneath. Sleeves were a bit long but it's great when I'm working. Kept the alfalfa, hay and snow out. I received it just in time for our-40° wind chills a couple weeks ago here in South Dakota. It did way better than I expected. We have a farm so I had to go out everyday in this weather. It kept the moisture off during the snows and the wind out during the 30+ mile an hour gusts. The nylon interior on the sleeves help my sweatshirts slip in pretty easily. The looser collar allowed for my neck Gator. The longer length in the torso kept the wind off my backside. Just enough fleece in the torso to keep me warm and still allow for good movement. The only thing I don't like are the pockets being so small and the only one with a button cannot hold the phone. There is no interior pocket. Add and large inside pocket, deeper outside pockets with flaps and it's a perfect work jacket that looks nice enough to stay on for my weekly trips to town!
review.name: Better than expected!

review.reviewBody: Good jacket with a nice color. I really like how deep the pockets are. I just wish it were a bit thicker and that the Sherpa lining were on the inside of the sleeves too.
review.name: Really like the pockets on this jacket

name: Lined Chore Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love cargo pants and these were the best I’ve worn in a long time. They are comfy and they fit perfectly. If you want cargo pants that can be used for anything, these are the ones for you.
review.name: Great cargo pants

review.reviewBody: The fact that i was given an option for size 30/34 was enough for me to consider buying but then seeing the material i had to buy. These are high quality, durable with deep cargo pockets and are all around well made. I will buy another pair and would recommend Under Armour to never stop making these.
review.name: Best quality cargos ever

review.reviewBody: These pants are great to wear, I wear them all the time for work. They are loose and great to wear during colder temperatures. I would definitely get a second pair.
review.name: Great pair of pants

review.reviewBody: Pants are hard to find, and these were a really good fit.

review.reviewBody: I love my new tactical Elitle cargo pants because they are made of lightweight yet very durable material, the great color green, and very flexible material (you could do barbell squats while wearing these pants). They have legroom but don't give a baggy appearance. I will purchase these in other colors—great everyday pants. I would recommend you give these pants a try!
review.name: These Pants are Elite Indeed!

review.reviewBody: Fit great, I recommend going up one size. Very durable and comfortable
review.name: Great item

review.reviewBody: Tough as nails pants , use these pants for my job and man do they stand up for all the harsh conditions . Highly recommend you get these
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: The tactical elite cargo pants fit great and made with very durable material. Pockets are located in great point on the leg. Hand pockets have reinforcement points for lights or knife. Very impressed with the quality
review.name: Tactical elite cargo pants

review.reviewBody: I love these pants but the fit for me wasn’t working. They sit too low on the waist.
review.name: Love the pants, but

description: Buy the Smartwool Smartloft 60 Hoodie Vest - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Smartloft 60 Hoodie Vest - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smartwool Smartloft 60 Hoodie Vest - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: There are a lot of things I like.  First off it's almost impossible to find a vest with a hood.  I use this on chilly windy days where a jacket is too heavy but you need a hood for warmth.  It is pretty warm and I like the outer fabric which is quite wind resistant and slick so it doesn't hold onto snow.  It is supposed to be insulated but I can't really tell, it isn't bulky at all.  There is one thing I find really annoying, which keeps me from giving this 5 stars.  The zipper is on an angle, it zips to one side rather than straight up.  I guess this looks fashionable but it makes it really hard to zip the vest up and be able to tuck your chin in to protect it from wind and cold.   Also note that the hood would not go over a ski helmet (it isn't advertised as such but wanted to note that since a lot of hoodies do go over a helmet).
review.name: Lots of things to like about this vest

review.reviewBody: Warm and well made, this vest is excellent for shoulder seasons or for layering in winter. The xl was was roomy but not too roomy on me, allowing for use with bulky sweaters (my usual top size is an xl or 14/16). The fit was true to what's shown on the model - this isn't a vest that'll cover your butt.
review.name: Great for layering

review.reviewBody: I have never used a vest for running before thought they were not enough warmth and probably too bulky to be comfortable but this vest is amazing. I am probably going to wear it the entire winter every single time. It's lightweight can wear what I want under it depending on the cold. I am in Calif so though it doesn't get very cold we do have a few low 30 days and this will enable me to not layer and then tie what's too heavy around my waist. I can't say enough about this vest and this website has the lowest prices every time I look for something for running. They have great customer service and highly recommend this vest and purchasing it here.
review.name: love this vest!

name: Smartloft 60 Hoodie Vest - Women's
Smartloft 60 Hoodie Vest - Women's

hasVariant.name: Prime Connect Free Ranger + Quiver Connectors Binding - 2024
hasVariant.description: Buy the Karakoram Prime Connect Free Ranger + Quiver Connectors Binding - 2024 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Prime Connect Free Ranger + Quiver Connectors Binding - 2024
review.reviewBody: Love the feel of these. They work exactly as described both on solid and split board (using the split kit). The air form straps are the best I’ve ever used and EVA beds are comfy. High backs are stiff and responsive but there’s enough flex in the chassis to allow for park use. Only scruple is that the prime quiver pucks don’t allow for as much stance adjustment as some other bindings, so you might have to go a few cm narrower or wider than you’re used to. Not really a problem. Definitely gonna buy the dual position risers with heel lock for the split kit. Buy these!
review.name: Awesome

name: Prime Connect Free Ranger + Quiver Connectors Binding - 2024

description: Buy the Coleman Living Collection Sling Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Living Collection Sling Chair
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Living Collection Sling Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this chair because the sling-style chairs (in a carry bag) provide little back support and are sometimes tricky to get out of. This Coleman chair is better as far as back support, but still has some slump to it.
review.name: Better than sling chairs

review.reviewBody: As a tall dude I spent a lot of time looking for a chair that went all the way up my back. I tried a ton of options including the yeti trailhead and none worked. This one is perfect at a fraction of the price. The standard seating is great and the recline options are a perfect napping position.
review.name: Big guy loves this big chair

review.reviewBody: This is my second “Living Collection” Coleman folding  chair I’ve bought in 4 years. It is well built, very comfortable and folds into its carrying bag with ease!
review.name: The Greatest and most comfortable, Folding Chair!

review.reviewBody: Such a nice chair, and love that it folds up like a regular fold-up chair. Wish it had a cup holder.
review.name: Best chairs!!

review.reviewBody: I love everything about these chairs (color, comfort, mechanics, especially that is reclines) but reeeeeally wish there was a lower seat height (like 12” ish) version.  It would be helpful if seat heights were included in the product description.
review.name: Seat Height

review.reviewBody: This chair is super comfy. However when I move the chair or stand up. back moves frequently. I think it needs a kind of locking system not to move.
review.name: locking system
comment:
Hi Jin Hyun,

Thank you for contacting Coleman, the Outdoor Company, and for taking the time to provide feedback on our Coleman Living Collection Sling Chair. We're sorry to hear that the chair did not meet your expectations; even though you find it very comfortable, you're still dissatisfied because it requires some product enhancements, such as locking system features. We appreciate you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize for your negative experience with our product. We work passionately to achieve such satisfaction from our customers by continuously improving our products and services. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department. If you have any further questions or concerns about your product, please visit the Coleman website, click on the question mark logo in the upper right corner, select contact us, and you will be directed to our contact form. Thank you very much, and have a wonderful day!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Most reclining chairs are the fold flat kind that are hard to pack. This has hard arms which is better than the sloppy fabric ones. It's sturdy with the back cross bar that you push down to lock it in place. I'm 6'1" and I can rest my head against the back, and go recline mode, fits and feels great. It hits me just below my cowboy hat, so it's perfect. Everything looks well made, time will tell, plastic bits seem to wear out over time. We'll be getting another one so there isn't an argument over who gets it.
review.name: Reclining Bag Chair

name: Living Collection Sling Chair

description: Buy the Black Diamond Icon 700 Headlamp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Icon 700 Headlamp
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Icon 700 Headlamp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is the best headline I’ve ever had. That works great batteries last long
review.name: Best head lamp

review.reviewBody: I have owned many head lamps and am blown away by the Black Diamond 700. The sophisticated light switches are incredibly useful and easy-to-use. I'll never go hunting or camping without it.
review.name: The best ever !

review.reviewBody: This is the second iteration of this lamp that I have owned and used. I put the Icon to work trail running, cross country skiing, mountain climbing, and camping too. It is super bright when I need it to be. I can change the colors or brightness when I need to. I can make the batteries last forever. It fits nicely on my helmet, but I can wear it comfortably on my head. This new version has an extension cable so that I can drop the battery pack into a pocket. This will be handy on Aconcagua this December.
review.name: Hard-working headlamp

review.reviewBody:
I used to work with sea turtles in Costa Rica. I bought it for the red, blue and green lights for my work. From the beginning I had problems because the lights didn't work well. When I used blue or green light, they changed themselves or they didn't work at all. 
I stopped using the Icon700 because one of the wires broke, like old plastic, maybe it didn't have 100h of use. 
I always thought it was a very good headlamp, powerful, good light... but the lights and the quality of the plastic disappointed me.
review.name: A little disappointed.

review.reviewBody: Great headlamp. With the extra weight on the back, using it on a helmet is the best option. Overall balanced but heavy and bulky for daily use. Extremely bright and good User interface.
review.name: Helmet Headlamp

review.reviewBody: Fantastic piece of hardware, as with all black diamond equipment built to withstand the harshest conditions. Love having a choice of multiple low light colors, sometimes the red is just not quite enough so having blue or green is great. Would recommend this product to any one! Thanks BD
review.name: Best headlamp on the market

review.reviewBody:
I live in Alaska and this winter was particularly brutal and cold. I used to be locked in watching Netflix and drinking all winter… and then I bought this light. I found all the loose change in my couch with this new found light source. I could afford xc ski’s with the change. Using my skis and becoming more active I gave up drinking and started geocaching. I have seen so many parts of my hometown with a new light, pun intended. It has allowed me to romanticize and fall back in love with the outdoors instead of netflix and chillin’. 

But now that it’s summer and sunny all the time it also works as a bottle opener to crush some frosty boys on an evening walk. Still a great investment. I am no longer afraid of the dark or winter.
review.name: I feel like a shark with a freaking laser beam on my head

review.reviewBody: The new features and increased output make this a nice update to the icons I have used in the past
review.name: Very cool

review.reviewBody:
This headlamp has a tendency to turn off whenever you jump or hit a bump while skiing. The issue seems to be loss connections b/t the AA batteries and the terminal at the top of the battery pack. If you shake it, you can hear a little wiggle in there, as if it all needs to be tightened up a bit. 

For a year or so, the problem was manageable by pushing the battery pack cap in tight and restarting. Then the battery pack unit started to develop small cracks in it (cheap plastic) which made the problem much worse. Overall, this productive is illustrative of the multiple troubles I've had over the years with BD lighting. Better to look to Petzl for lighting stuff.
review.name: Turns off when shaken

review.reviewBody:
I bought one headlamp and the rechargeable pack as a gift for a friend who helped me out a lot after my wife died. I haven’t gotten it to him yet but if I get any feedback, I’d be happy to share it.

I used mine the other night under my Seattle sombrero blowing snow during our blizzard here in Madison WI. It worked well, It was comfortable and I could get my hat over it, which was a bonus, considering the conditions. It’s a nice piece of equipment.
review.name: Icon 700

name: Icon 700 Headlamp

review.itemreviewed: Black Magic Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: These bibs are very comfortable, made of high quality materials and the fit is shockingly perfect. I have been searching for bibs to fit my body type (slim waist, thicker thighs and long legs), and these fit so wonderfully! The reason I am leaving 3 stars is the lack of a buckle on the straps, so getting in and out of these is a pain. You have to loosen the shoulder straps and move them over your head, then readjust the straps to your preferred tightness. The straps are also made of the same material as the bibs, and easily folds/twists under the fastener during the loosening & tightening and is challenging to straighten out.
review.name: PERFECT but hard to get into

review.itemreviewed: Black Magic Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bibs fit perfectly. Very well made. Nice and warm. Dope bibs! As always 686 knows what snowboarders want in a bib.
review.name: Bibs are sick!

review.itemreviewed: Black Magic Insulated Bib Pant - Women's

review.name: warm bib, keeps the snow out

review.itemreviewed: Black Magic Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The fit was great, these are hands down the best bibs I’ve had for snowboarding.
review.name: The fit was great, these

review.itemreviewed: Black Magic Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the sage/cypress green color and the subtle diamond print! I am 5'6" 130 lbs. and exchanged for the small after originally purchasing the medium. The medium had too much extra fabric at the waist/rear. The small fits great with room to spare for this to still be a very comfortable, stylish alternative to more constricting ski pants. I love all the pockets and optional vents for powder days
review.name: Great bib

review.itemreviewed: Black Magic Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Top quality bib. Super compfy. Size was perfect.
Nice insulation. Colour was as ordered. All good. Thanks.
review.name: Super comfy bibs.

review.itemreviewed: Black Magic Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the fit and color. They compliment my outfit nicely.
review.name: Love the fit and color.

review.itemreviewed: Black Magic Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are long enough for my 33" inseam, have a side zipper for my hips to get situated before we head out into the cold, have great pocket access, and the insulation is perfect for snow blowing, snow sitting, snow socializing and snow skiing. The straps are comfy, stretchy and I still have room to loosen them in case I get taller. Perhaps the only downside between picking a L vs XL in these is that I don't have as much room to layer tops or bottoms under the bibs. 

For reference: I'm 5'9" 185#. My regular pant size is 10 Long (Old Navy) and my shirt size is men's medium. I generally do a lot of snow sitting and playing, so coverage, stretch and length were all important factors for me.
review.name: Great match for my needs!

review.itemreviewed: Black Magic Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The fit, the color, and the vibe is more than I even knew I wanted :heart:️
review.name: Best fit vibe check

review.reviewBody: it's lightweight, but one of the baffles got basically zero down at the factory. The baffle is stitched through on all four sides so it can't be that the down migrated to the sides. It just wasn't put in in the beginning. good materials. poor workmanship.
review.name: one of the baffles wasn't filled

review.reviewBody: Great! Light weight . Perfect for Camino de Santiago !
review.name: Great! Light weight . Perfect

review.reviewBody: I love the overall idea of the quilt, it is very comfortable to sleep in. However, the down moves to the side of the quilt every night. So I ended up being covered by only a thin layer of fabric. Really dissapointing!
review.name: One major flaw

review.reviewBody: The very first night I slept in it, it got down to the temp limit and I was fine. My feet got cold around 5:45 AM and it was time to get up then anyway. FWIW - I slept only in a pair of shorts that night. I could have gotten up and added a puffy and some socks and probably slept until well after sunrise.
review.name: Perfect For Warmer Trips

review.reviewBody: the only time I'm cold with this is user error. I either try to use it when its way too cold for what its rated for (and I'm still surprisingly still warm-is) or I don't use the straps to help reign it in around my sleeping pad. I love it and its exactly what I was looking for, a super small summer bag and super packable winter cabin trip bag!
review.name: so light! so packable! so warm!

name: Vesper Quilt: 45F Down

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Aspire Super Stretch Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got this jacket for a trip to Glacier later this year. I've had several rain jackets by big name brands but they didn't keep me dry - this was on several lists as a top choice with a high ranking for dryness. Had an Initial test outside in a storm and it held up well - all dry! It is very high quality and I am excited to use it more in the years to come!
review.name: Stylish and keeps me dry!

review.reviewBody: love all the zipper and pockets
review.name: Perfect summer fall rain jacket

review.reviewBody: It moves with you.
review.name: Extra Extra

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket -provided excellent waterproofness on a 7 day canoe trip where it rained most days. I purchased the jacket less than a year ago and one of the front pockets has worn right through. THe material in the pocket is very thin and I am super disappointing in the quality of them. Based on this alone, I would not recommend. :(
review.name: Great jacket but...

review.reviewBody: Jacket is comfortable, room to layer underneath, length and cut are flattering, and waterproof/windproof in all the elements. I bought one size up than my typical small to leave extra room to layer sweatshirts/sweaters and it fits perfect. Great stretch, the wire in the hood is great, especially with how roomy the hood is, no wind/rain getting through this jacket.
review.name: Favorite jacket

review.reviewBody: I love the cut and especially the zippers at the side - I can protect my camera when on a hike or adjust it for comfortable bike riding. Packs up small and light so it will be great for travels later this year. But I was hoping for miracle fabric. I wore it in Vancouver drizzle for about three hours and arrived home with a damp back and arms. Not soaked. Just damp. It has its limits and I will dress accordingly.
review.name: Not quite as waterproof as I was hoping

review.reviewBody: I needed a waterproof jacket for a 4 day expedition race. The versatility of this jacket made it the perfect waterproof layer. The jacket breathed well, especially with the side vents. I stayed dry during a downpour. It kept the wind out while biking overnight. I paired it with a thin down and was comfortable when the temperatures dropped. The fit was as expected and flattering. I wouldn't have changed a thing about it.
review.name: Exactly the jacket I was looking for!

review.reviewBody: I recently wore this as a waterproof layer over a puffy jacket during a moderate snowshoe trip and also in decent "Seattle" rain and stayed dry. I've only worn twice so far and I love it.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this coat because it said "super stretch" and it is just that. I bike in the rain frequently and I love how this jacket is so thin and stretchy. I use it as a waterproof top layer to whatever I'm wearing and I am obsessed that the side zippers go from pit to hip. It's truly one of the most versatile jackets I own.
review.name: Excellent Rain Coat for Outdoor Activites

review.reviewBody: This jacket was a warranty replacement for an older raincoat I bought from Outdoor Research. I am so happy with the warranty service and will go out of my way to buy Outdoor Research over other brands because of how I was treated.
review.name: Amazing Warranty

name: Aspire Super Stretch Jacket - Women's

comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: I bought these as I loved my very first pair of Salomons. This pair I've only had a couple months,  hike once a week. One of the loops that hold the laces already broke,  with only normal wear and tear. They did give me a gift card number for the amount, I'm trying another pair. I hope the quality is better. If you're an avid hiker, I don't recommend these.
review.name: It's a let down for day hikes
comment: Hi. We appreciate you providing us with your comments. We're pleased that our staff was able to resolve this issue for you. If you have any further questions, concerns, or problems, please don't hesitate to contact our support team.

review.reviewBody: These shoes are way too narrow in the toe box, they started giving me bunions (and I have feet with very average width)! I have never had pain on the side of my big toes before. They hurt no matter what I do (like light city walking or hiking with heavy gear). Also, one of the lace loops just broke, making the lacing all uneven, and that happened after not even 3 months of use. Please avoid Salomon, they are poor quality and way too narrow for normal feet!!
review.name: Way too narrow & poor quality
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your experience with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody: The 2-3 day shipping ended up being well over a week and I ended up leaving for Oregon without them.
review.name: Slow shipping
comment: We are so very sorry for the shipping delay, we've emailed you to see if we can help resolve this.

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for a rugged hiking shoe when I didn't want to use boots.  This fit the bill perfectly for the most part.  But, they felt a bit wide so I unded up returning them.  I'm getting a different pair that I've been told are a bit narrower.
review.name: Fantastic hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wanted something lighter for travel than my Salewa Mountain Trainer Lite Mid GTX boots (which are also great) but with more support than my Scarpa Neutron 2 Trail Runners. These fit the bill without question. No break-in time required, fantastic support, and incredibly comfortable. They look great too. The Salewa lacing always ensures good fit. I have a feeling I might be wearing these more than the other two moving forward.
review.name: Awesome - my new favorite

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been searching for a lower cut hiking shoe that will work in warmer temps but was three season. I wear orthotics so that was a requirement on fit. Also wanted a longer lasting high traction outsole, and this checked all the boxes. Fantastic fit out of the box, those who say very short break in period were spot on. Downsides were limited, they are a little on the heavy side, but with a leather upper that’s not a dealbreaker. They are a little warmer than expected, will wait to see how they vent in Arizona summers. I wear a 14 in running shoes, these are about the same.
review.name: Excellent everyday hiking shoe

name: Alp Trainer 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I typically use the Gnarly Hydrate on most runs, but for those longer runs when eating calories can cause problems, this is my go-to. The electrolyte ratio is perfect for most athletes pursuing high output or hotter activities and the carbohydrates used in this do not cause any gut issues. Easily digestible carbs that keep me going for hours. I prefer to drink fuel versus eat anything (mostly) because it's easier on the stomach allowing my body to focus on keeping my legs moving versus working extra hard to digest solid food. The flavor is great and doesn't leave any weird feeling in my mouth.
review.name: Great for Fuel and Electrolytes

name: Fuel2O

review.reviewBody: Disappointed.  Had higher hopes after very positive experience with Scrambler 35.  Main reason for purchase was alleged better ski carrying capacity.  Right shoulder loop attachment mechanism poorly designed and implemented, and broke after 10 minutes.  Good news is pack is incredibly versatile, and a few minutes of improvisation seems to have overcome design failures.  Await further testing in mountains.  Storm flap facing wrong way in my opinion.   Side access compartment spot on, and multiple webbing/attachment points very good, but overall seems a step back from Scrambler.

name: Snoskiwoski 30L Backpack

I’m trying to figure out how to put something in there to help “size” it a bit.  Other than that, they are fabulous!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Slide High Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this show and the way it fits. They're cute and everyone has asked where I got them.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Slide High Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cute & Comfortable --- Winner!  You can't go wrong with this shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Slide High Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I love the Sorel Kinetic… I have 4 pairs of Kinetic sneakers.  The support was great for my knee prior to replacement and after and have another foot issue.  Needed sandals for Florida, so comfortable, but after a mile walk, got huge blister on each big toe.  So disappointed…I have to return them.
,
review.name: Kinetic sandals
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Slide High Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, this beautiful sandal doesn’t have much padding where insole supposed to be ( it has none) and with wearing it around house it beginning to irritate my foot soles to the point of hurting.  I will need socks to wear which isn’t great for summer.
review.name: Nice but not comfortable insoles!
comment: Hello Elenas, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry KINETIC™ Impact Slide High Women's Wedge Sandal didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Slide High Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Sooooo comfy!!!!!love them. Runs large, nice colors. Lots of complements.
review.name: Couldn’t imagine how comfy they are….

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Slide High Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and stylish.  One of the features I think is important is the ability of the shoe sole to be flexible, so that when you take a step, the shoe feels like it is moving with your gait, instead of fighting it.  This sandal performs well.
review.name: Comfort !

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Slide High Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super comfortable! I wore them for hours while standing and walking. Everyone loved them.
review.name: Comfy Cute Combo!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Slide High Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very sturdy and cute slides. Pretty comfortable, feel confident that I would not roll my ankle. I am a true 8 and my feet fill the whole sole so if you are in between sizes, I recommend sizing up.
review.name: Great for multiple seasons!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Impact Slide High Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these in black and they were delivered yesterday. I wore them last night and they fit true to size. There is just enough “give” so they aren’t too tight.  I’m buying them in another color I like them so much!
review.name: True to size

review.reviewBody: The tape is thin and requires a lot of stretching and pressing into place to get something close to a seal, but I've had the Orange Seal tape either refuse to ever create a seal, blow out as the tire was inflated the first time, or blow out on the road over the four times I've tried it.
review.name: Doesn't work well

review.reviewBody: Sealing up a set of tubless compatible alloy road rims, and found this tape to be super thin - deforming to the spoke holes so much that it didn't hold a seal.  I ended up having success with  duct tape and would recommend that approach instead of buying expensive rim tape.

review.reviewBody: Like so much of BD, this is a jacket designed by skiers. It’s got nice insulation, but not too much. Waterproof membrane. Great hood to keep out the elements. Great construction. I love it. Perfect for really cold days or fighting the storm to hit the good stuff.
review.name: Perfect insulation weight. Well designed for the elements.

review.reviewBody: Nice jacket. High quality for sure. Would have loved for it to fit, but the armpits were real tight. I’m 5’11” 140lbs, fairly muscular build. Body was loose enough, I could have work a layer beneath if not for the tight arm openings. Length was good. Arms were a tad long but passable with gloves on. Tight armpits made it impossible to wear even a fleece under the jacket.
review.name: Armpits are tight on XL

review.reviewBody: The Black Diamond Recon Jacket is a top-notch choice for those seeking a waterproof, insulated, and lightweight jacket. Its ability to stretch ensures a comfortable fit, while the insulation reduces the need for multiple mid-layers. The jacket's clean lines and uncomplicated design make it a stylish addition to any outdoor wardrobe, and the rock-solid build quality ensures it will withstand the elements. This jacket is a must-have for anyone looking to stay warm, dry, and comfortable on their outdoor adventures.
review.name: Black Diamond Recon Perfect Blend of Comfort and Performance

review.reviewBody: Nice features but nothing you don't need. Light insulation makes it a great ski shell.
review.name: Only what you need; nothing you don't

review.reviewBody: Very high quality that is thoughtfully made. The pockets are excellent and are just what you want when skiing a mountain. The hood is big too, so it fits over your helmet. I wore it in 26 degree F weather with long sleeve shirt and thin quarter zip synthetic material and it was perfect temperature.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Awesome fit just missing a few simple key features I’d have liked. A tougher build for the price eg gore Tex, better designed interior pockets and the armpit vents could have mesh supports instead of blank unhinged openings.
review.name: Awesome fit just missing a

review.reviewBody: Great jacket for skiing, lots of pockets for everything and a great fit! 6,2 and 245 and the XL fits perfect.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: This seems like a great jacket but haven't had a chance to wear it skiing yet.
review.name: Great Jacket so far

review.reviewBody: Love the jacket but too tight in the armpits--I'm 6'3" and 200 lbs. Ordered a Large size and the jacket is perfect length, but not enough play in the arms--the seems had constant pressure in the arm pits. Same issue with the non-insulated.
review.name: It's the pits

review.reviewBody: I ordered a large in order to wear layers underneath while skiing and morning dog walks. Good fit and a very well made shell.
review.name: Well made Shell

name: Recon Insulated Shell - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loved the compact size for getting this to camp, and was way easier to clean than our old camp cook set. We still bring our insulated mugs for coffee, but the cups our great for our morning chia or flavoured cold drinks. Will be using those when we travel too!
review.name: Space Saving & Easy to Clean

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for cooking for two, very compact for motorcycle travel.
review.name: Perfect Size

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: I really liked the concept behind this set but was concerned upon purchase that the material would not be durable/rugged enough for cooking in the backcountry. Unfortunately, my assumption was correct. I burnt a hole in the larger pot on its first outing (1 week trek in Dolly Sods). I'll still be able to use the cups and the bowls but those aren't the reason I purchased the set. Disappointed with this purchase and do not recommend.
review.name: Not durable enough

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product is a game changer specially if you're going camping. The ease of it makes it easier to store and organize. They feel sturdy and well manufactured. I love this product and will definitely buy more in the future.
review.name: Great Portable Product

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the perfect addition to our camping/hurricane evacuation box. It barely takes up any room, everything folds flat, and fits inside the pot. The pot lid and handle act as a latch to keep it all in place. Cleaning is easy and have not had any stains on the silicone. My only issue was the pot handle is hard to attach. Great product otherwise.
review.name: Perfect Set

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't gotten a chance to take these backpacking yet but they have been handy for shorter car camping trips. I love that they pack down so neatly and all fit in the one pot. They are really light and I'm excited to use them once we start backpacking this year.
review.name: Great 2 person cook set

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve always used a titanium or stainless steel set up for expeditions, but this kit’s utility was apparent right away for sea kayaking expeditions. It’s impressive packability is so much easier to cram into small hatches and any small voids. I really appreciate this factor the most. 

I wondered how it would hold up to my typical backpacking/kayaking stoves. A full, high burn on my usual stove (I use the MSR Pocket Rocket) caused no issues- it was a very quick boil for a full pot, actually, and the blue flame beneath the pot didn’t come anywhere close to the suggested max flame extent. I was kind of surprised that the instruction text on the bottom of the pot was not even affected. 

When you add in the two plates, two cups, and two bowls included in this kit- and it still packs as small(!)- the total weight is very backpack friendly especially if you are traveling with a partner or group. If I am solo, I would just take a small portion of the kit, and it is very comparable to my titanium gear’s weight (but far more packable.)

I honestly wasn’t sure when I first saw this kit that I would swap it out for my metal gear, but testing it out has sold me on it earning a place in my kayak programs.

One ask: if they added or sold a snap lid for the bowl, I would love to make it my snack/lunch carrier in my day hatch as a swap for the Tupperware I usually use.
review.name: Great for sea kayak trips

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are amazing! The time it takes to boil water is half the time on this pot, and the cups hold the heat well. I didn’t have to worry about burning my hands either! Easy to clean, and easy to store and take on the go!
review.name: Amazing

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband was over the moon when this arrived.  We are avid campers and he is always looking for me ways to condense stuff down smaller.  He said he’s never used a compact cooking pot before and couldn’t believe he was going to get to use one forever now.  He said the handle was super easy to come off the pot for storage and it lays all the way flat.  It also comes with 2 cups and 2 bowls and they all fit inside the pot for storage.  We will be using this all summer long!
review.name: So compact!

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This collapsible one pot cook set is not only well designed but it’s also very versatile. It lays perfectly flat and can easily be stored in a bag or with the rest of your camping equipment. The silicone material is very sturdy and can easily hold whatever you want to cook. Since it’s made of silicone, it makes cleaning a breeze. Highly recommend this product.
review.name: Versatile and well designed camping pot

name: Frontier UL Collapsible One Pot 5-Piece Set - 2 Person

hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Space Cowboy Sleeping Bag: 45-Degree Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have to preface that I may have just gotten an old bag- when it arrived from the resaler (Ultralight Olllutdoor UK) it didn't exactly exude the loft afforded to it by the reviews and so forth.

It lasted me well on a month long backpacking trip in summer. Warm enough and very packable and light. Would I use it again? Entirely certain I would.

That being said, it doesn't last long in storage. Whilst waiting for the next summer (now) for around eight months, it lost all its loft.

It's been stored in a dry box uncompressed with silica to absorb moisture, so I'm unsure about why it lost its puff- not happened to me before, not with down or synthetic, and it's refusing to show me any consideration and loft up again for me (my arms are honestly exhausted after two days of fluffing and beating it!)

Anyway, great bag, but be careful about storing it. It'll handle water and wind like a champ in the field but it won't be happy being kept in storage.
review.name: Good bag, poor longevity

review.reviewBody:
First, let me start off by saying this is personal preference review and not a negative one. There’s only one true flaw. I went back and forth on a bag vs quilt for a while, I wanted something small and lightweight. Obviously, I landed on a bag. I’ve had this for two years now and have used it several times. 

The bag itself is super light, packs quite small, and has a great look to it. I went purple. I’m familiar with the synergy straps, as my first Thermarest was the Antares 20, ~8 years ago. These however basically ripped off first use, not overly concerned i continued my trip. By day two, they were completely frayed and torn apart. I know I move in my sleep, but I don’t think I sleep like a monster!

It is what it is… I still use the bag, actually I just used it for week long car camping trip. My biggest gripe with it. And again, this is purely personal preference. Is the zipper doesn’t go past your knee, understanding we’re saving weight but it’s a flaw imo. It’s frustratingly annoying when you want to kick your feet out and can’t. 

The rest of the bag?…. It’s a good bag. Like I said, it’s light, packable, looks good, pretty comfortable but I chose the wrong sleeping bag for myself. That’s all! I recommend this bag, but I really recommend the brand. The whole brand of Cascade. Not the best review, but maybe it helps.
review.name: Good bag but.. for me..

review.reviewBody: Packs down and performs well in wet environments I took it on a 5 day backpacking trip in NH and it was awesome!
review.name: Great for summer backpacking in New Hampshire!

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect bag for an overnight or an extended weekend trip. Fits nicely with plenty of room. Compresses surprisingly well. Great choice.
review.name: Lightweight and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Really light and packs down quite small. Fits my NeoAir XLite sleeping pad perfectly. I didn't try it in really cold weather, but it was fine for temperatures in the 50's and 60's. I would have preferred a bag without the hood, but overall am really pleased with it.
review.name: Good for travel and warm weather backpacking

review.reviewBody: It was an excellent lightweight sleeping bag and I use it for long distance backpacking travel. Had a comfort night sleep at temperature of 3 Celsius in Winter. I was just a little bit disappointed because the Synergy Link connectors doesn't fit to my ""Trail scout"" sleeping pad that's it all.
review.name: Perfect & lightweight for a long distance backpacking

review.reviewBody: Light weight, zip only goes half way super annoying, rates for 45 degrees I was cold in a shelter at 52 degrees. Great for summer not for spring or a cold summer night.
review.name: Light that?s about it NOT 45 degrees

review.reviewBody: So to preface this I do use this sleeping bag and I do like it... but I have some thoughts. If it came with a compression sack it would take up virtually no room; I know people have mixed emotions about them but its what I expect from Therm-a-Rest at this point. Next the material feels a little strange on my skin but that's more of a me problem than a Therm-a-Rest problem because I see no other mention of it. This is my best warm weather bag, but I just don't entirely like it. All my other Therm-a-Rest products are wonderful, but this bag is just slightly underwhelming.
review.name: I somewhat like it

review.reviewBody: I have used this bag a few times and have been pleased. I think it is a great start for layering with other liners or camping blankets to push against colder conditions. Which is where most of the stars come from. The materials are so thin I am concerned about durability. Though in the few times I've used it there has been no issues. It is staggeringly light. I wish the zipper was a little longer and that the loops for the pad were a touch wider.
review.name: Great Base

review.reviewBody: Probably great for most people, I am always cold. Thought I would try it. Turned out that a 50degree night required me to wrap up in another sleeping bag over this one. Works more like a sheet on a warm night...which is what it's intended for. I returned it for a warmer bag. I would buy it again if I was in a warmer climate.
review.name: I would recommend it for warm climates .

review.reviewBody:
I was super disappointed in these knee pads.  The protection is awesome and I was really encouraged by other reviews. I got them in a medium which I'm usually spot on and they were a little small and tight but not too bad.  I went out for a 2 hour ride and could not even handle them because the velcro straps (top and bottom) squish into the back of the knee and rub like crazy.  I ended up taking them off and putting them in my pack they rubbed so badly.

The velcro straps are way too high on the bottom of the knee pad and way to low on the top.  It puts those straps square into the fold of the backside of your knee.  I would not recommend them at all.
review.name: Great protection, VERY uncomfortable!

review.reviewBody:
They give good protection. Have had a few crashes that would have been far worse had it not been for the solid padding and coverage the pads provide. 

However, they get uncomfortable on longer rides as the lower straps cut into the back of my knee.  
Also the thigh straps are awkward to tighten as I have significant overlap of the straps. 

Will be switching to other pads.
review.name: Good Protection, But Uncomfortable

name: Flex Knee Guards

review.reviewBody: Enjoying new pedals although right pedal has spontaneously come unclipped several times! I followed all the installation instructions same as the left pedal which does not come unclipped unless I want it to
