Finally replaced my older speed play pedals with the latest Wahoo version .
Like the newer cleats and I’m hoping these lady just as long . They have been my choice for almost 20 years
review.name: Wahoo pedal upgrade

review.reviewBody: Great product, disappointed that this company is nearly impossible to call. I ordered the pedals, next day on sale that I should have received.
review.name: Great product, disappointed that this

review.reviewBody: I had been wanting to try Wahoo pedals for a long time, and decided to get them for my Zwift Ride. Really great pedals, easy installation. I'll definitely upgrade my road bike with the power meter version next season
review.name: Great Pedals

review.reviewBody: I used Speedplay pedals 30 years ago when I last had a road bike and liked them then. I just bought a road bike recently and started with Shimano SPD-SL pedals. I never felt comfortable getting in and out of these pedals and without a lot of thought before doing so. Decided to buy the Speedplay Comps and within 10 minutes of using them, have no issues getting in and out at will. In addition, the variability in dialing in the float without having to buy different float-based cleats is an added plus! Love these pedals!
review.name: Back to Speedplay Pedals and Loving Them!

review.reviewBody: It comes with everything and is easy to install as compared to the older model.
review.name: It comes with everything and

review.reviewBody: Easy to use. Work well. I also have the power link zero dual pedals. They are just as nice as those. They snap in and out really easy. Maybe to easy considering I’m use to the standard tension cleat. I’ve put about 200 miles on them and don’t think I will change them out.
review.name: They work good

review.reviewBody:
Fourth bike with speedplay pedals.
Great float and no thought/effort in and out. Obviously my go to pedal
review.name: Fourth bike with speedplay pedals.

review.reviewBody: Love this hoody so much. Worth every penny. Lovely and soft inside, it's thin but warm. Perfect with a base layer or Tshirt underneath for warmer days and a jacket on top when its cold. The sleeves are very long but I like that. The hood can be rolled under at the back of your neck so it looks and feels like a big soft collar. I love wearing it under my Gillet when I'm walking the dog. It means I don't have to carry a bulky hat in case it rains. I've got the Deep Ink colour which is a lovely navy. I originally ordered the Atlantis colour which is absolutely beautiful but a bit bright for me so I changed it.

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes so much, I needed hiking shoes and decided on these. As someone with bunions, it is a gamble ordering shoes online. These did not disappoint!! They fit perfectly, didnt even need to break them in. Been hiking plenty of times with these and they are great - the stability, the grip, the look, the comfort. love!
review.name: Amazing!!

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been searching for a good pair of hiking boots for months, and unfortunately, I will have to keep searching. I purchased these because they received high ratings from a popular review site, but I regret it. The color is terrible- the white instantly gets dirty and gross. Additionally, the laces (which are flat and thin) are extremely hard to tighten and loosen. I also got terrible blisters on my arches from wearing them. Safe to say, I am very disappointed.
review.name: Not Ideal
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ended up returning them. They felt comfy but I just couldn’t get over how substantial they felt. You need to be doing some major hiking or a moon landing to wear these bad boys.
review.name: Moon boots

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved these at the start of hiking season this summer. They are very cushioned, which was important to me because I sustained a broken heel a few years ago and after 4 surgeries I can hike in these and my foot doesn’t hurt! They have also kept my feet dry. However, after hiking 10 hikes this summer, 6 being 4000+ feet of altitude, the tread seems to be wearing quickly. On my last two hikes I slipped twice on wet granite rock where I hadn’t before. I don’t feel secure enough to wear them anymore. Here in Maine, we have a lot of muddy wet trails even in dry conditions. All the other Salomon boots have very durable treads, why hasn’t the company done the same with these?
review.name: comfortable hiker

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've had these a month and used them in Lake District and Yorkshire Dales. A pleasure to wear. I was concerned the heel would be poor for descending rocky outcrops but they're fine. Sole prob not as grippy on rock as other Salomons though. Waiting to see how they wear too. Recommended for paths, not so much rock scrambling.
review.name: Great fit and ankle support

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these after buying and trail-testing four other hiking boots pre-travel. They were amazingly comfortable right out of the box.  Took them to Iceland and wore them on a five day hike on the Laugevegur trail. My feet felt great the entire time and the boots handled all types of terrain—providing stability up and down steep slopes, loose gravel, occasional snow and ice, crossing streams. No blisters, no soreness, and felt great to put them on day after day. The cushioning was superb; I credit the boots for my lack of back pain despite prior back surgery. Truly grateful I found these.
review.name: Amazing for long hikes!!!

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots were very supportive and comfortable! They were comfortable to walk in right away. I was relieved because I did not leave any time to break them in.
review.name: Comfy from Day One

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Faites un peu grandes. Je suis habituellement un 10.5 et j’ai pris la grandeur 10.
Elles sont confortables et légères
Pas très hautes.
Je recommande!
Livraison assez rapide
review.name: Bottes légères/ confortables

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Mid Gore-Tex Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have all kinds of Salomons (ski boots, hiking boots, trail runners) in 7.5 and had to exchange these for 8 due to toe hitting front.  Once I got the right size, and got over the (white) basketball hip hop look for hiking boots, I have loved these - much much less foot fatigue than my regular thinner soled boots.  About to wear on a long distance walk.

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a coat that would cover my son's knees in the Chicago winter. He likes it and says he's warm enough. I bought size M (he is 5 feet 9 inches and weighs 150 lbs).
review.name: Nice warm long coat

review.reviewBody: I wear a 3XL to 4XL. Why this discrimination to BIGGER People. It's frustrating to find bigger sizes and they charge us more.
review.name: BIGGER SIZE?TALLER

review.reviewBody:
While living in Chicago, I wanted the Nuptse parka when TNF released it in the 1990s but it was too expensive for my budget . 
Well it’s back and awesome and I can afford one
The materials are quality, the build ideal and the fit excellent.
I now live in Portland where it is the perfect late fall and winter coat (about 40 degrees warmer here so can wear it without layers and still be toasty warm!)
Highly recommended
review.name: Terrific coat

review.reviewBody: This is an excellent parka built very high quality. It is medium difficult getting the 2 zippers to meet together to engage the zipper. It is very frustrating and makes the jacket feel cheap. Being hard to zip in the cold would absolutely suck, especially with cold hands. Also, I believe that the internal storage could be better. Its just a huge pocket thats made with very thin material without any zipper. It seems tacky, and honestly makes the jacket feel cheap. It seems like it was clearly overlooked. A jacket of this cost and caliber should, in my opinion, have zippered and lined internal pockets for valuables, phone, wallet. Im never putting my wallet nor anything of value to me in a thinly lines zipper less bag.
review.name: Fantastic quality but a few nitpicks

review.reviewBody: For a bigger man a xxl will not work!!!! I really was hoping this would be my go to coat especially since it's long and versatile but it's not because the xxl is small
review.name: Bigger Sizes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for super cold winter
review.name: Great coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I don't hate walking the dog anymore. This is a "magic" jacket
review.name: Winter warmth magic

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this coat online after loving my original Nuptse. This is a great jacket too I just tried it on and didn't love it, so I ended up returning. Nothing against the coat - it was fantastic and super warm - but just not what I was looking for. (I will say it fit a little larger than my original nuptse, so maybe size down if you purchase)
review.name: Good coat, just not for me

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is one is the warmest coats that I own. It generally doesn't get cold enough to wear it, I usually wear it for more fancy occasions because of its length. At 6'3" it comes to my knee which I love.
review.name: Perfect long make coat

name: Nuptse Parka - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I ordered these socks, received a package about a week later. Unfortunately what I received was not what I ordered. I received a pair of pants instead.

After chatting with customer service they agreed to send me a new pair. Two days later they email me and say that the item is now not in stock. They refuse to issue me a refund until I send back the item they mistakenly sent me. (Total value $16). Very petty.

Will not be shopping here again and won’t recommend this website to anyone.
review.name: Awful customer service

review.reviewBody: If you are like me at get blisters between the toes, do yourself a favor and pickup a pair of these socks. I am trying to get into distance running and was about to quit because of the blisters. These socks literally fixed it all for me. Use the size guide to make sure you get the right fit. They are worth it.

review.reviewBody:
Great fit and weight, and the work great with the Orvis Pro waders.  However, the laces break within a couple months and the soles are coming unglued after less than a year of use. hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Climber's 3.0 SL 2 Jersey - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm a big guy (6'4" 230) so I ordered a XXL but just laughed when it arrived and I held it up.  I had just been folding my 10-year-olds shirts and it looked no bigger than those.  Some stretch to the fabric of course, but I think I'd need at least an XXXXL in whatever Italian greyhound sizing Castelli uses.  Back it went and didn't even consider exchanging for a XXXL, which is the largest they offer.
review.name: Quality Jersey But Ridiculously Small

review.reviewBody: I'm always so excited about any Caselli and equally worried about the fit.  I'm 6'1", 190LBS.
review.name: Great product, tough fit

review.reviewBody: Purchased a Large in silver gray, and I literally laughed out loud when I held it up. It looked like it might fit a small child, it had to be a mistake in the label. For reference, I wear tight cycling clothes, I’ve been riding for 30+ years and formerly racedI’m 5’7 and 135 pounds, in street t shirts a size Small. In Craft I comfortably wear either Small (form fit) or Medium (regular clothes fit). Weird.
review.name: Runs very, very small

review.reviewBody:
I have three of these jerseys, they’re perfect for hot humid weather.

Typical Castelli cut and quality, very form fitting race cut, super-light and breathable technical fabrics. Despite the exceedingly light fabric I’ve found Castelli to be very durable, I’ve never had a Castelli jersey develop any rips or tears, they wear very well season after season.

I’m a medium in most other brand  jerseys, but I always order a size up for Castelli.  Unless you’re a skinny Italian pro rider with 2% body fat, order up a size.
review.name: Perfect Hot Weather Jersey

review.reviewBody:
I'm absolutely thrilled with the Climber's 3.0 SL 2 Jersey! The fit is sleek and comfortable, with a snug design that allows for a full range of motion. The fabric is incredibly lightweight and breathable, keeping me cool and dry even on the most intense climbs. The jersey's moisture-wicking properties are quite impressive, and feels amazing on long rides. Whether you're a seasoned pro or a weekend warrior, the Climber's 3.0 SL 2 Jersey is a must-have for any serious cyclist. 5 stars and highly recommended!

Fir sizing comparison I am:
5’10”
175 lbs muscular built 
40” chest
32” waist 
I’ve bought a size L and it fits really well with a subtle compression around my arms. I could probably wear a size M for more compression.
review.name: Awesome summer jersey

review.reviewBody: Runs extremely small, the Large looked like it could fit my toddler. Had to return and upsize.
review.name: Terrible Sizing

review.reviewBody:
I ordered this jersey which was pictured as mainly white with subtle gray graphic stripes. It came as mainly gray with very slight white accents. I wanted a white jersey for hot summer days, and ended up with a gray one.
Just a warning for anyone else. 
Otherwise the jersey is fine. I am 5’10” and 155 lbs, and size L fits me fairly tight.
review.name: Not as pictured.

review.reviewBody: It is nice and comfortable smooth fiber but it runs small
review.name: Great jersey

name: Climber's 3.0 SL 2 Jersey - Men's

description: Buy the Coleman 1 Burner Propane Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 1 Burner Propane Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman 1 Burner Propane Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Super easy to pack and take with you when you are limited on space. I had one of these when I was deployed to Iraq and made 100’s of pots of coffee on it. I also used my canteen cup to heat water to shave with. I use it now with my kids when we go to deer camp. It doesn’t take up much space. I use to work hurricanes and no power. I would be working out of my truck days on end. This stove cooked me tons of meals.. and did I mention coffee?
review.name: Great little burner

review.reviewBody: I love the convince of how easy this transports. It’s great for backpacking. It is very durable yet very fuel efficient. The heat distribution is pretty good for a single burner and unless you make a mess cleaning is easy.
review.name: Very lightweight and easy to transport make it ideal for backpacking

review.reviewBody: Light weight and very functional. Keeps weight down, but enough fuel to last longer outside.
review.name: Bought 3 and love each

review.reviewBody: Compact, stable and sturdy. Perfect for morning coffee making when camping.
review.name: Classic camp stove for one

review.reviewBody: Bottle top propane stoves are an essential camping product! Instead of packing up a heavy grill, we have packed this and used it to make many things like breakfast, coffee, and baked beans! It's easy to use and easy to store. Highly recommend this for any camping beginner or pro!
review.name: Camping must have!

review.reviewBody: We love to have home cooked meals when we aren’t home and this did the job of the stove. As you would use the stove to heat things or even cook you can do the same with this. It literally packable so you don’t have to worry about leaving it. It just depends on if you leave the tank on or even how much you cook for how long the fuel last. Cleans easily just don’t clean it while wet or you’ll get burnt.
review.name: Great for camping

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using mine for about twenty years, it works great and cooks/warms up food very fast.
review.name: Great, simple product

review.reviewBody: Works exactly as it should. More stable than I expected
review.name: Lovely

review.reviewBody: Pretty durable, very portable, it is fuel efficient with good heat distribution and good safety features.  It’s perfect for camping and beach days.
review.name: Great for camping!

review.reviewBody: I bought and used this for the cold nights my son had baseball games. Kept me warm throughout the game. Worked perfectly!!! Easy to carry along.  Didn’t use much propane either.
review.name: Kept me warm!!

name: 1 Burner Propane Stove

review.reviewBody: As a long-time Ex Officio fan, I was excited to try these new boxers. They are incredibly soft and comfortable, but the lack of a fly has been a major inconvenience. After several weeks, I still find it frustrating to pull them down every time, especially when wearing a belt and having to deal with buttons on my pants. While the comfort is great, the design choice to remove the fly makes basic tasks unnecessarily annoying. Unfortunately, it’s too late for a refund, and for the price, I expected better functionality. I hope they return to the tried-and-true design.
review.name: Don’t buy these

review.reviewBody: I have a variety of other styles of ExOfficio briefs that I like quite a bit.  This style fits fine, but does not have a Y-front opening and takes significantly longer to dry.  These are ok, but too expensive.
review.name: Not my favorite ExOfficioBrief
comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.exofficio.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
ExOfficio Consumer Care

hasVariant.name: Miko 25L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Miko 25L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for my everyday needs. I use it as my man purse and as a daypack. Has hardly pockets. Definitely love the small pockets on the hips for keys credit card etc.
review.name: Perfect versatility

review.reviewBody: This is a great pack for hiking and travel. The shoulder straps are very well designed and comfortable as are the waist straps. The zipper pockets inside the waist supports give extra storage for things like glasses, and are easy to access. I also like the zipper design which makes opening and closing the zippers easy from any angle. The mesh pockets on the outside have lots of room and are also easy to access.
review.name: Great pack for hiking and travel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used the Miko 25 for a week of hiking in Yosemite and it worked out GREAT! Plenty of room for everything, and I really appreciated the extra big pockets on the sides for our water bottles. It was 90+ degrees in Yosemite that week so we carried extra water. The zip pockets right at hand level are SO nice. We kept our cells phones in there and I was thankful to finally have a pack where our phones were easily accessible without taking off the pack. Also appreciated the coolness on my back, with the breathable design. My last pack would leave my back sweaty. Not so with this one. Material was definitely rugged enough for all our hiking needs. The pack is actually so versatile that we are now using them for our carry-on bags for all our flights. And we plan to bring ONLY these packs for a trip through Europe next year. All in all, we are VERY happy we picked the Miko 25!
review.name: Miko 25 is GREAT!

review.reviewBody: Needed an updated day pack for a trip to Yosemite / Half Dome and decided to go with a Gregory as I'm tall (6'5") and love the customization options. Worth noting that I'm slightly biased as I also have used an Gregory 75L for overnight trips for the last several years which I'm also a big fan of. That said, the Miko was super comfy for the 14 mile trip, forgetting that I was wearing a pack at most times, and also had great storage options. Highly reccomend!
review.name: Love This Day Pack!

review.reviewBody: Bought the Miko to use as a daypack while hiking the Camino de Santiago.  I tried many other packs in my search, including the Osprey Talon, Osprey Stratos, and Deuter SpeedLite. For my body type, the Gregory Miko was the most comfortable of the bunch. In particular, the "body hugging" shoulder and hip straps really do work as advertised.  Perfect capacity for my needs.  Everything seems quality built, at least matching the quality of the Osprey and Deuter packs.  This is my first, but won't be my last Gregory purchase.
review.name: Perfect for my needs

review.reviewBody: Had an REI pack and returned it to get this.  Great pack, super comfy.  Lightweight, good useable space.  I'm trying to use this as a travel/hiking backapack and I'd love a few more organizer pockets for electronics/docs/etc.  I still use it as a personal item carry on, and its a great trail pack.  Would recommend.
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: I've taken this pack on a couple hikes so far and I couldn't be happier with it. The fit is great and it's very comfortable. It has plenty of storage space for extra layers, water and snacks. I'm sure I'll be using this pack a lot this summer.
review.name: Super comfortable pack

review.reviewBody: My Gregory packs never disappoint. This pack is my long day or heavy day pack.
review.name: Love this pack

review.reviewBody:
Just recently got this pack and have used it on a few day hikes up in Waterton and Glacier. Great little pack for daytrips. We climbed Siyeh peak and this pack held my water, snacks, extra layers and binos. Carried very well and I love the large waist belt pockets for phone, knife, etc. I put my sunglasses in the small top pocket and my wallet, keys, and power bank in the internal mesh pocket. 
I'm excited to use this pack on many more day hikes.
review.name: Fits my needs fantastically!

review.reviewBody: Tons of storage for day hikes, convenient water bladder pocket with clip if you purchase Gregory bladder as well. Plus, I used it to hide my engagement ring, and it worked perfectly so thats a plus!
review.name: Great Backpack

name: Miko 25L Daypack

review.reviewBody: Awesome grip, bit stiff, wish they were water resistant
review.name: Purchased these to run on ice and in snow.
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback!

review.reviewBody: From the get go these sneaks were fantastic! I have plantar fasciitis and recurring sprain of my heal tendon and the sneakers supporting my feet immediately! No break in time needed.
review.name: Cushiony and very supportive!

review.reviewBody:
I have put about 80 miles in the past month of wearing these shoes on the trail in AZ. They did not really need to be broken in and I wore them on the trail just out of the box.  I am very happy with the comfort level and the grip on the trail surfaces.  The toe box seems a bit wider than I am used to, however, if I lace them in a different way they stay secure on my foot.  I would purchase these again.  

My only problem with these shoes is that I am worried that material/grip on the front of the toe box will become separated as they are always hitting rocks.
review.name: Peregrine 14 Trail Shoes

review.reviewBody: Since moving to Washington, my dog and I are constantly on the 40 miles of wooded trails in our area. The Saucony running shoes that I used in TX needed a traction upgrade. Sliding down rainy declines is a thing of the past with Peregrine 14’s.
review.name: Great traction
comment: Thanks for sharing your experience!

review.reviewBody: Love the fit and love the color! These are my everyday urban trail shoes
review.name: My fav

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shoes. I had a runner with really soft soles and ended up hurting my foot. These give me so much support!
review.name: Peregrine 14 trail runners

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit and great traction on slippery terrain.
review.name: Perfect shoe!

review.reviewBody: Cute shoe, runs small. I ordered my usual size of 7.5 but I definitely should have sized up to an 8. This shoe did it have the roomier toe box that I was expecting after some online research. If you need extra room in the toe box, this is not the shoe.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: I own three pairs of the Peregrine 14 Saucony shoe. I'm suffering from plantar fasciitis in one of my feet and these are the best shoes I've found to take the pressure off. When I find a pair of shoes that work this well, I buy a couple extra pairs . So happy that I found them!
review.name: Helps my plantar fasciitis!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes -  bought Women’s -size 11 1/2. I needed comfortable shoes for a trip so purchased the same shoe in a Men’s size 9 1/2 because the local sports shoe store said  they didn’t have a women’s size 11,  but the fit wasn’t quite right. Then saw these on-line and took a chance and the fit is perfect. I didn’t have time to break them in but wore them for 10 days on a bus/walking tour and they are still great. Hope they continue to make more Women’s size 11 1/2 as my feet are stretching as I get older and walk more.
comment: We're happy you love them!

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Switchback Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Switchback Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Switchback Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I hike thousands of miles a year and have long used the Neoair Xlite short. It worked ok on well-made trails such as the PCT, but since I have started hiking more rugged routes such as the Hayduke and ODT and NNML the Neoair has often gotten holes that are sometimes hard to locate and repair in the middle of nowhere. I was skeptical that a foam pad would work for me but did my research and tried the shorter-length Switchback. It isn’t anything like sleeping on my mattress at home, but after 20- and 25-mile days I can sleep on it better than I expected. And no popping in the middle of the night! Thanks, Nemo.
review.name: Yay, it doesn’t pop

review.reviewBody:
I’ve used this pad about 10 nights so far. I fall asleep well and feel pretty comfortable on it but by every single morning it’s an accordion at the bottom of my tent and I’m sleeping on the ground. I’ve put a sheet under it, over it, both at the same time and it still slips down and folds up throughout the night.
 I also don’t think it’s comfortable against bare skin. Rolling over on it with bare skin wakes me up at night because it makes a suction cup noise as I move. 
With skin covered and maybe staking down the pad(?!) I would really like this. I appreciate the effort but it needs improvement.
review.name: Good when it works

review.reviewBody: I typically don't care enough to leave a review for a product, but this was my first sleeping pad, I am very satisfied, lightweight and has a very solid and reliable feeling to it. Definitely doesn't feel cheap, i can't speak on the long time durability as i only have 2 night on it. It is about as comfortable as you would expect to be while camping/backpacking.... but for the price I can say i made the right choice and it was worth it in my case.
review.name: Review for NEMO switchback sleeping pad

review.reviewBody:
Only a step away to be  the best in the industry… Short and narrow for tall people. 

I have been using sleeping pads for more than two decades in the Himalaya and Alaskan mountain ranges year around. I used all the brands, they were good but not the best feeling high up in the mountains. 
Switchback gave me the comfort and the feeling a wilderness educator or a parent will expect in the back country and in the high altitude. Soft, light and sturdy enough but not too hard. 
Few things can make it one of the best in the industry. Make it available WIDE, LONG and Extra long for tall people. I know NEMO team you can do it.
review.name: It is affordable and best in the market.

review.reviewBody: Très confort et vraiment résistant. Je l'ai amené dans de nombreux bivouac, que ce soit en matelas principal ou sous le matelas gonflable, il est vraiment efficace. Cependant il est bcp trop étroit, je prends des matelas wide chez les autres marques, et  en matelas gonflable, et clairement c'est le seul défaut de ce matelas, c'est de ne pas être assez large. Il mériterait vraiment une version wide, même si plus cher, je l'achèterai sans soucis, et je le recommanderai.
review.name: Très bon matelas mais pas assez large

review.reviewBody: I have tried many sleeping pads and this is hands down the most comfortable non inflated pad that I have slept on.  After a week of use, this is a keeper.
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: I haven't put it to use yet; however,  I've tested it at home. Surprisingly comfortable and with my sleeping bag on top it will provide even more cushion. Pressure points were not an issue. Seems to distribute your weight evenly.  My only concern is that it will slide in my car. We shall find out soon enough. But for comfort, definitely four stars, compacatbility 5 stars, and durability seems to be a 4.  I definetly recommend!
review.name: Car Camping Mat

review.reviewBody: I've spent most of my life camping on self-inflating air mattresses so I was excited to get the Switchback foam mattress. I loved my first one so I just got another one for my wife. They are super lightweight and much easier to setup/packup since you don't have to inflate/deflate. The comfort factor is most important though - the foam is firm but forgiving so sleeping on dirt or even a wood platform is perfectly comfortable. This is my forever go to camping pad.
review.name: Most Comfortable Camping Mattress I've owned

review.reviewBody: I’m 6’3” and 180lb. Best sleep ever in a tent. Elbows do hang off but I don’t want to pack anything wider. No stress or discomfort with deflating overnight from a tiny hole. The folded shape makes it easy to pack and it makes a nice seat. Compared to a traditional flat foam roll this is a lot softer.
review.name: Remarkably comfortable

review.reviewBody: The Nemo Switchback is the BEST.  It is far more comfy than the Exped Flexmat or the Thermarest Z-Lite.  It even packs/folds down better.  The problem is the width.  I've been using the Flexmat, which is pales in comparison to the Switchback, because it is WIDE enough to accommodate my 25" inflatable sleeping pad.  Nemo - check out the reviews...we want a wide option!  Pretty please?!
review.name: The best...except it's too narrow

name: Switchback Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I would have loved to wear them. Your size app was wrong. I ordered the size suggested and they were to big. I am surprised you did not have the option to get the right size built right in.
review.name: I would have loved to

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have owned the same shoes in the past the only issue I have with them is that the soles wear out too fast and come apart . before the rest of the shoe is worn out,but they are a great comfortable pair of shoes.
review.name: I have owned the same

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had a pair of these years ago that lasted forever so when I needed a new pair of shoes for general hiking and some everyday wear in the winter and fall I picked up another pair of the Targhee's. These are not quite the same as my old ones. Keens have always had very hard insoles in my opinion and these are not any softer although claiming to be a better insole. They also must have changed the heel to toe drop on these. If I am wearing them around town as an everyday work shoe or on just flat ground and not hiking up a hill I feel like these are pushing/leaning me forward constantly and kill my knees and heels after a few hours of wear.
review.name: Used to be better, wish it was a flatter heel drop

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have bought several boots over past 4yrs or more. The first pair I got lasted better than year which is saying something because I’m hard on them do to the kind of work I do. Now sole of that shoe never did come apart, but every boot I got after that one the soles come apart with in 3 to 5 months. I’ve read several reviews and there’s a common theme the soles are coming apart and have been for several years. Which tells me you’re not addressing the issue. It’s a tripping hazard for me and it ticks me off when that happens. It’s not rocket science go back to the glue or contact cement that you used 4 or 5 years ago. I used contact cement to repair the sole so I can get close to a years use out of them. I shouldn’t have to do that. I’m starting to look elsewhere for a good pair work/play boots. I hope you will all take a hard look at it. Your reputation is on the line.
review.name: Don’t take my word listen to other customers

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Husband is on his second pair. First pair lasted many years and are still wearable!
review.name: Awesome Boot!!!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Still have my Targhee II from years ago. They are work shoes now. Still my favorites. These fit and feel just like the original. Classic!
review.name: Still have my Targhee II

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these to wear when training for search and rescue, or when on a mission. I was able to wear them all day, straight out of the box. I bet they will feel even better after they break in a bit. Wore them in mud and snow. My feet were dry and comfortable.
review.name: Nice boots!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I get a new pair every year. The reason is, the bottom of the tread keeps coming unattached from the shoe itself. Out of 6 pairs, they have only replaced 1. I bite for with the composite toe. The tread last 3 times as long.
review.name: Ok boot

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This hiker is my standard footwear for fall, winter, early spring. I have owned them for years and they never disappoint. I wear them hiking, in the yard and around town. They feel great right out of the box.
review.name: Every Day Footwear

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I think I just retired these boots after 10 years of hard, rocky-terrain Texas ranch work. I had them professionally repaired/sewn twice. I never knew the style name but I got a gazillion miles out of the leather Keens and they were the best I’ve ever had by far. I will order another pair but upsize 1/2 size because my feet grew. I’m pretty sure it was this Targee II style….we will see if they are still made so well…..
review.name: Amazing, favorite boots ever

name: Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I got this from my son the quality is just amazing He's had his previous one since he was 13 years old and just outgrew it. I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a very nice jacket to keep them warm.
My son loved both the jacket and the sweat shirt but, unfortunately they were both too big.  Can I exchange them for a smaller size? How do I go about exchanging them?

Love the style, way better in person, fits very well!!
I will purchase another color for sure
It was a gift for my son. The fit was perfect and he loves it. It was to replace one he got about 20 years ago.

review.reviewBody: Very happy with the quality and fit. Glad I purchased the tall vs regular fit. My husband loves the ribbed cuffs to keep cold out and warmth in!

review.reviewBody: This was a Christmas gift for my husband and he's been raving about it since he broke the seal on the package. He absolutely loves everything about it and is looking into getting the same one in more colors.

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket! While it's warm, it's not too heavy.

review.reviewBody:
The rain defender is perfect mid weight jacket I use it almost daily with temps in 30's here in Michigan. Highly recommend!
I am 6'2" with long arms so when buying a jacket it has to be in tall sizing. I have owned several Carhart canvas work jackets over the years and they always are true to size when labeled and sold as tall! That is what lead me to shop for a casual jacket from carhart and I was not disappointed. Arm lengh is perfect the jacket nice looking and comfortable.

hasVariant.name: Zenith Climbing Rope - 9.5mm

review.reviewBody:
TL:DR; Great short/gym/ 40m rope, go unicore if your doing longer pitches. 

This is my go to 40m burner/ cheap workhorse rope for local cragging and gym climbing. Feeds great, feels slim, but not unicore. I’d recommend a unicore rope if doing more than short easy access crags and gyms.

 Going on my fourth rope (shenanigans, chops, and 300-400 pitches combined) and yes the sheath can get fuzzy, but I’ve put this rope thru a lot, it’s been reliable, and has a soft catch. Saves my other ropes for when I travel.
review.name: Favorite short rope

review.reviewBody: Bought the pink 70m 9.5 in Sept for fall sport climbing season- after only 4 days of sessions outdoors, sheathe is starting to look fuzzy already which is disappointing. Love the color, how well it handles, and catches feel fine. Feels surprisingly thin for a 9.5 which is a plus for some. Disappointed in the durability as my past edelrid and mammut ropes went through at least 20 days outdoors before showing major wear
review.name: Handles well, ok sheathe durability

name: Zenith Climbing Rope - 9.5mm
